doc_id: Fawconer - 1774 - The Sporting Calendar, containing an account of the plates, matches, andf sweepstakes_page_182.xml
text:
124
OCTOBER, 1773.
Same day a sweepstakes of 500gs each, h. st B. C. was
won by
Lord Grosvenor's Mambrino — 1
Lord Clermont's Marc Anthony, 8st. — 2
Mr. Vernon's Florizel, 8st. 6lb. p. ft. — Four to 1 on
Mambrino.
Same day Mr. Scawen's Alexis, 3 years old, 7st. 4lb.
beat Lord Clermont's Pulpé, 4 years old, 8st. 4 lb. Ditch
in, 200gs.— Three to 1 on Pulpé.
Same day Mr. Walker's Hibernian, 8st. beat Mr.
Strode's Cicero, 8st. 7lb. R. M. for 100gs. — Two to 1
on Cicero.
Same day Lord Clermont's Johnny, 7st. 7lb. beat Mr.
Brand's Don Carlos, 8st. B. C. 200gs. — Six to 5 on
Johnny.
Same day Mr. Scawen's Mecea, 8st. paid 25gs compromise
to Lord Clermont's Squirrella, 7st. 10lb. across the
Flat, 100gs, h. ft.
Same day Lord Clermont's Hercules, 7st. 9lb. paid
100gs compromise to Mr. Ogilvy's Consul, 8st. 7lb. Ditch
in. — Lord Clermont to have staked 6oogs to 400.
Same day Lord Ossory's Chalkstone, 7st. 11lb. paid
forfeit to Lord Grosvenor's Sweet William, 8st. 10lb. B.
C. 200gs. h. ft.
On the 20th the 140gs for 6 year olds, carrying 8st.
10lb. and aged 9st. 2lb. the sole property of subscribers,
B. C. was won by
Lord Bolingbroke's Marianne, 6 years old — 1
Lord Ossory's Augur, 5 years old — 2
At starting, 6 to 4 on Marianne; in running, 6 to 1
on Augur.
Same
